Here is my system my friends all want to get their hands on.

I call it My Market Order System and it's just that.

It's been making me profits for some time and I hope it does the same for you.

This is what you need:

1) 3 Level ZZ Semafor Indicator... That's It !

**_THE RULES FOR UP TREND_**

1) Only Trade The Daily Charts

2) Ensure You Have A Nice Trend

3) _ALL TRADES ARE MARKET ORDERS_

4) Place Your STOP LOSS UNDER The **GREEN DOT** After It Closes

5) Place Your **BUY STOP ORDER** 10 Pips Or So Above The GREEN DOT

6) Keep Moving Your Stop UP Every 50 or So Pips

7) Close The Trade When A PINK or **RED DOT** Appears.

That's It !

To check to see which way the market is trending...  
eg: BULLISH MARKET:  
Open you 4H Chart and see if it making it's way up.  
Do the same on the Daily and to confirm check the Weekly Chart too.  
If they are all trending upwards this would be an UP TREND....  
The chart above is a UP TREND...  
If it is a DOWN TREND just look for the opposite signs..

Hi ukmartini I do use the PINK & YELLOW markers the YELLOW or #3 are the stronger indication of the next move.  
I suppose it can repaint that's why I use Market Orders. That way if it does reverse there is no loss because the trade would not have been triggered.  
  
Another way you could use it is wait for an Engulfing candle in the opposite direction after the pink or yellow marker.  
Best idea is test it on a demo account till you fine tune it to your own liking.   
Cheers !

Hello orid and bob,  
  
Correct me if i understood the rules wrongly.  
  
Entry and Exit rules:  
  
SELL: When the number 3 dot appears, if the dot was on the TOP, so we will take this candle's low + 10 pips more below for Sell Stop Order, and the SL would be above the DOT, and Closing of the trade will be on the first dot with closed candle of 2nd or 3rd number DOT depend on which one appears first.  
  
BUY: When the number 3 dot appears, if the dot was on the BOTTOM, so we will take this candle's high + 10 pips more above for Buy Stop Order and the SL would be below the DOT and Closing of the trade will be on the first dot with closed candle of 2nd or 3rd number DOT depend on which one appears first.  
  
@Orid that's why we have too much minuses, the dots repaints badly and that is the cause.  
  
Best Regards,  
PrinceWahaj

Hi Guys ! ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f601.png?v=15.1)  
Sorry if I have confused everyone, I have a habit of doing that sometimes.  
This is what I do with this trading system......  
But remember I'm only a newbie too and not an expert, so maybe between us all we can improve on this Semafor System.  
  
SELL TRADE: this would be the end of an RISING TREND  
Eg: Candle with RED DOT ( Or Yellow If You Wish )  
  
1) Place your SELL STOP ORDER at the BOTTOM of the CLOSED CANDLE 10 Pips Below If You Wish.  
2) Place your SL ABOVE the RED DOT  
  
So in other words the RED DOT is indicating us to SELL !  
The RED DOT will not move once this candle is closed UNLESS the next candle decides to go further UP.  
If it does move your SL ABOVE once again and move the SELL STOP ORDER Up also.  
  
The image in this post is a current trade I'm in with the NZDUSD

Hi guys. Allow me to add my 2 cents to how I trade the semafors. I use 4 timeframes. 15M 1H 4H and D. For buy signals I look for a strong green semafor forming on the 4H or D charts. I like to line up the semafor with a support level. I look for a semafor to appear on the 15M chart and I buy at the close of that semafor candle on the 15M chart. I set my stop below the 15M semafor candle. Its usually about a 10-20 pip stop. This has a LOT less drawdown. If the semafor on the 15M chart holds and price moves up, I move my stop to break even when a red semafor appears. I continue to do this until the 4H or D Semafor candle holds.   
  
Exiting is a little different. I don't use the semafors to exit as I like to cut my losers short and let my winners run. semafors repaint so I set a target and put a takeprofit there. I like to raise my stop as it moves up...I do this with price action.

The way I figure it is, if you place your BUY STOP ORDER above a GREEN Dot which is a BUY signal.  
If it repaints the trade would not be triggered. So all you would need to do is readjust your entries.  
For example in the current AUDUSD pair at the moment.  
With this system patience is very important, remember :nerd:

Ive just put the none repainting semaphor on my chart and compared just the biggest swing signals which are the circles with 3 in on the repainting version  
  
I looked at August to current date on CADCHF Daily and got the following results  
  
NT means there was a 3 ball but no trigger the next day ....the pips value is the max any triggered trade went to ,so is not the actual number of pips you would of gained  
  
NT NT 173 NT -47 NT 292 NT 121 NT NT 268 NT NT NT NT NT NT -64 NT -79 and then the last signal is the one hi lighted on the CADCHF chart daily which triggered Friday  
  
So the sequence is 173 -47 292 121 268 -64 -79  
  
Maximum movement pips gained but not achieved 664  
  
Using the type of stop I personally use on daily charts I get 89 -47 215 30 198 -64 21= + 353 pips  
  
Which I think is great for 1 swap plus we have gained a winner going from-79 to +21   
  
Strike rate over that 6 month period 71% which again short time test but healthy figures  
  
Now add in all the majors ...... looks very promising  
  
Paulus

I posted the non repainting indicator for the purpose of backtesting if someone wants to do it. As I mentioned, it needs adjustments - the color and size of dots is changeable.  
It is easy to figure out visually, which dots are which, to match it with ordinary Semafor: grey is Semafor1, green is Semafor2 and red Semafor3. Basically, you need only red for entries and green for exits.  
In inputs you can adjust how far the dots are from candles.

I exit slightly differently still use opposing dot but then move dot accordingly  
  
Ideally I like to risk 5% on every trade so take entry to stop loss and calculate 5% of bank then take TP at 2 x 5% so winners are 10% losers 5% RR of 2;1  
  
Advantage over existing exit is that if you have a large entry bar and lose say 60 pips then you have 3 winners on a small entry bar of 15 pips each even though you have 3 winners and 1 loser you still end up losing  
  
An EA im running on another system looks at the account and automatically calculates 5% and uses that figure it does that for every trade so all trade are equal regardless of pip size also if I then take a trade on another swap with a different pip value then the EA will also convert that to 5% of the account so all trades no matter what size the bars over all swaps are equal  
  
Not sure if can be implemented here Il take a look  
  
P

Nice im looking not trading the system atm  
  
the more I look the more jumps out to my already said by Bob  
  
To trade the trend results in fewer attempted failed trades  
  
If a swap is heading down then the semaphor will keep trying to pick the bottoms ..this can results in several failed trades before the actual bottom goes in  
  
So if a swap trend for a couple weeks things could get hairy on the account front,in a chop market then the system I think comes into its own which is normal the reverse for every other system out there....the big question is when are we in chop and when are we about to trend...we can narrow that down I think  
  
Look at the circles given by the none lag indy trying to pick bottoms in down trend now compare that to the circles going with the trend ..they almost pick every retracement

I have sent the information required to the coder to make the dash board as outlined in my earlier post.When its completed I will post it here for all to use and evaluate  
  
Changes can be made as required and on request if we think its worth it  
  
I have been studying the 5min with the semaphore indicator ,its viable but requires 2 filters in my opinion  
A filter to take only signals with the current trend and a filter to filter out some of the false signals caused by repainting  
  
I used my 5% risk and 15% return on every signal  
  
IE .. Risk 5% on every signal (entry to SL calculated at 5% of account balance)  
Target ( TP) set at 3 x the risk = 15%  
Every loser loses 5% every winner wins 15% hence 3:1 RR

Hello Bob , first of all thank you very much for introducing me to this fantastic indicator and then so I'm sorry for my English because I'm not native speaker , I'm Italian . I have slightly modified your rules considering the maximum and minimum of candles including the shadows rather than closures to put orders . I always add spread over 10 pips and doubling the pips for the stop loss bringing to 20 plus the spread . Of course when the order does not start and the ball moves to the new candle at the end of the day I move the order accordingly. If an order starts and touch the stop loss at the end of the day I reposition a new order increasing it a little be, ie from 0.02 to 0.04 , 0.06 in the case of new stop and I think while controlling trends do not happen to have more than three consecutive losses often also because the ball moves without touch the order. I use some moving averages to help me understand the trend and I use a channel to see if the price is in overbought or oversold area . Thanks again I'll keep you updated on the results.

Wow, it's so great to see people supporting each other like this. I know this might sound crazy but I feel that with support like that, we all can achieve our dreams and goals in this business. I feel that if you keep like minded people around yourself, the possibilities are endless. I've read the entire thread to get caught up on everything and I'm really liking what I have come across.  
  
Everybody is doing a great job contributing to the thread.   
  
I have a suggestion that may be used as a filter. Not sure if it's worthwhile but just something that popped in to my head as i was looking at the charts. I believe it will probably work best on the daily chart since on the smaller time frames price will move back and forth more often before picking a direction.   
  
My suggestion is if we have a 3 at a peak indicating a possible short move, instead of putting the limit order 10 pips below the location of the 3 ball maybe it will be more beneficial to put the limit order 10 pips below the low of the last bullish daily candle. Of course this would be vice versa for a possible long position.  
  
I understand that this may get us into trades a bit later than it would by putting the limit order 10 pips below the location of the 3 ball but I think it would help us stay out of the whipsaw situation. Of course if the daily candles are small because the last few days price has not moved much then we could end up in whipsaw situations also but this is just something I thought about as I was looking at the charts.  
  
I wanted to share my thoughts with the thread because I see everybody contributing and that is a great energy to have.  
  
As of right now I'm not demo trading this system just looking at the charts. I'm waiting for the EA to get created that Paulus is having done for us (thanks Paulus) so I can apply it to multiple charts and see how the system does from that point. My initial reaction to this system is that I think it has great potential and will be something that will put some green into our pockets.

dashboard is with the coding guy and ive been told 3-4 days  
  
I will be building more onto it but its a start,Iwill also want 5min added as well as trades in line with the trending indy nonelag dot,and then pull backs to the fib 61.8 this especially removes alot of false signals  
  
Then it needs to handle money manegment  
  
how are you manually going to balance funds so all trades are equal when trading across 30 pairs ??  
  
You take trade on AUD/NZD and make 30 pips you make $195  
You take a trade on EUR/USD you lose 30 pips you lose $300  
  
Now measure your entry to stoploss use that figure and calculate 5% of your bank then multyply by 3 to get your 15% TP and also do the conversion of the $pip value.The EA can do all that seamlessly....you you need an edge to start with

Hi  
  
yes snap for me also my trading platform actually has 55 forex swap although some have massive 20 pip spread def ones just for the daily or 4 hour time frame I think  
  
For trading on the 5 min ive been looking at commission only brokers for this as thier spead on the swap will be zero  
This help on the 5mins greatly  
  
Take a classic signal your entry to stop loss is calculated at 6 pips and this will be calculated as 5% risk of account balance therefore your target is going to be 3 x 6 pips = 18pips which if it wins will be a 15% gain on account balance.  
  
But if you factor in the spread of say 3 pips then we need 18 pips + 3 = 21 pips and dont forget your not taken out as price hit your TP its when the bid or ask hits your TP depending on whether you are short or long  
  
On commision only broker as the price touches your TP you are taken out for a main $10 contract on EU cost is $18 which works out 1.8 pips ..we just don't take it into the calculation as normal  
  
Ther are also brokers that operate zero spread and only take thier commision if you win they take none for a losing trade,they also do mini and micro  
  
I thik its worth looking at  
  
On 1 hour 4 hour daily weekly etc the spread doesnt become an issue  
  
P

Now id like to add a few things I have attached an indicator called _nonelagdot this is what I use to filter signals into up or down trends  
  
In the parameters if I can have Length and colours please  
  
In the screen shot you will see NLD   
  
If a 2 or 3 ball is on top and calling for a short if NLD is red then we have a short with trend situation  
  
If a 2 or 3 ball is on top and calling for a short if NLD is blue then we have a short with counter trend situation  
  
If a 2 or 3 ball is on bottom and calling for a long if NLD is blue then we have a long with trend situation  
If a 2 or 3 ball is on bottom and calling for a long if NLD is red then we have a long with counter trend situation  
  
In the dash board if we split each box with a black line and as an example the screen shot 1HR 2Ball on EURAUD shows  
  
green box telling that ball is on top and then red box telling NLD is red so this would be a counter trend situation  
  
On the same time frame but AUDCHF we have red box telling us red ball on top and then another red box telling us NLG also red so this is a with trend situation

Ok I hope this makes sense it fairy simple Il throw in a few charts

  1. Use the dashboard to find any green on green red on red meaning 2 or 3 ball semaphore in the direction of the trend
  2. The trend is determined by nonelagdott ..you can use anything your happy with, moving averages adx etc etc
  3. Find the swap and load the chart on 5min
  4. The example shown is a short,so I now need price to come up above nonelagdot this is to filter out some false semaphore signals
  5. The 1st chart shows the 2 ball signal that would of given red red on my dashboard
  6. I then draw a fib line on the last swing down as shown in chart 2 this can be where its drawn or across poits A and B the blue zone inbetween 50% and 61.8% is my IDEAL window thats where price has to be when I get the semaphore signal but it can retrace further as long as nonelag dot stays red.
  7. Normal entry after that with limit order but nonelagdot has to stay red at time of entry as in chart 3
  8. Risk is 5% of account TP 3 x risk = 15% 3;1 risk return you can use what % you want 1% risk on SL = 3% risk on TP RR will be the same pips gained will be the same

Guys, congrats on this very interesting thread!  
  
I like the idea. Also I like the way Paulus digs into the methods.  
  
Here is my two cents...  
  
I like the idea, but wouldn't do it myself because this method is a counter-trend trading -- like catching a falling knife bare hand.  
Mind you, you use a daily chart. This is not an intra-day swing trading. You are trying to get a retracement of a big wave that lasts weeks.  
It's not my cup of tea. (just personal preference...)  
  
So, I just twisted this;  
Try a 15m chart with an EMA48. If EMA48 goes down, you go only short at the BALL2 or BALL3. If the ball is on/near the EMA48, that's better. You go long in the opposite case.  
  
How about that![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f911.png?v=15.1)

The new version of the dashboard Im hoping will be slightly easier to read V6  
  
Slightly different text at head of coloumns  
  
Instead of 2 colour blocks per ball there will be 3

  1. 1st block tells us if ball on top or bottom if red block its on the top for a short if green block on bottom for long
  2. 2nd block is NLD colour if trending up then green block if trending down then red block
  3. 3rd for me but others may be guided by it.. if this block is green block then price under NLD if red block then price above NLD

So if you get 3 green blocks in a row we have ball on bottom NLD is uptrending and price has pulled back beyond NLD  
  
if you get 3 red blocks in a row we have ball on top NLD is downtrending and price has pulled back beyond NLD  
  
You have a pop up alert and sound mine is set to 5min only alerts with no sound so only 5min signals pop up for me  
  
Cheers P

  1. 1st block tells us if ball on top or bottom if red block its on the top for a short if green block on bottom for long
  2. 2nd block is NLD colour if trending up then green block if trending down then red block

if you get 3 red blocks in a row we have ball on top NLD is downtrending and price has pulled back beyond NLD

Hey Paulus  
  
Here is food of thoughts about 5m. (don't take this one too seriously --- I cooked up this system in 3 minutes![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f60a.png?v=15.1))  
  
Set-up  
EMA200 with envelops +/- 5 pips. You try to get the bounce at EMA200 +/- 5 pips.  
Entry: When (1) the price crosses or touches the envelop, (2) you see a red dot or a Ball3, and (3) EMA200 slants toward the bouncing direction (yes, it must be trending).  
You enter at the bar close! (the bar with the dot/ball) -- meaning, you don't wait for the next bar close.  
SL=10 (not sure.... can be 20).  
TP=a red dot or a Ball3 higher up/lower down.  
  
Do you think you can make an EA??![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f609.png?v=15.1) it can be pretty good if using it for trending markets. Oh, BTW, the pair must be with tight [spreads](/brokers/spreads "View Live Spreads on the Broker Guide") \-- less than 1.5.

To exit on the next opposite dot may well restrict your profits though I think in low volatility periods they can appear very quickly in the opposite direction  
Perhaps you can do a manual back test of 1month apart 3 times TP ro risk and 2 times tp to risk  
  
System with 1;1 RR can work very well but even with a strike rate of 80% technically yu could have the 1st 20 signals all losers so you need to build MM around that figure risking 1% per trade would work even 5% would hold it you also need to look at viability it has to make money get 10 losers in a row to begin with and you then need 10 winners just to get back to break even if using 1;1 risk reward ...on daily charts that may well take a month or so   
  
With 2;1 the statistics are just so much better  
  
As for the EA.. I cant code I use a professional coder and it cost me money the dashboard has gone back and forth several times and an EA will follow

hi whenever,  
I'm actually trying to work out whether to pull out on appearance of new ball or trailing stop , or jumping stop ,  
still not decided , jumping stop hit on that us jpy I posted at +50 pips , sometimes the trade gos a long way for the good after a new ball appears.  
So at the mo if I am in green and new ball appears try to adjust stop accordingly at least 25 pips but prefer 50 pips. or grab what you can if it reverses.  
Entering I try to only enter in direction of a no 3 ball ,(misses a lot of good trades) I just try to follow that no 3 ball by around 50 pips or more depending how it looks ,until it reverses . I think from past trades the four hour is very good but im trying to have less screen time so daily for me.  
im not good at explaining hope this helps . I try to keep to original rules as much as poss  
best regards Orid peter

Hi Bob,  
  
When do the 'dots' appear? If it calculating the high/Low, Wouldn't it need to have retraced quite a bit to determine that its a high? Which would mean a very lagging indicator and you wouldn't have entered/exited by the dots?  
  
Kinda like Parabolic SAR, looks really good if you entered the beginning of the candle where the dot changes, but in reality, it has to retrace and touch the other dot to create the new dot, hence, lagging and losing trades.

Difficult to tell with paper results I need an EA and test it on the various time frames.  
I wanted the dashboard so I could tell if its worth taking the next step and creating the EA I think it is..  
  
the main problem I have is that when we go short .. we are by definition in part play of a 123 reversal which can destroy the trade.  
  
How ever this pattern may be of an advantage to us which is what Im looking into now.  
AS ever money management is the key here ..take 100 signals 60% strike rate with a 3;1 RR  
  
_On 100 trades_  
  
we lose 40 taking each loss as 1 pip = 40 pips loss  
We win 60 at 3;1 taking each win as 1pip = 60 x 3 x1 = 180 pips wins  
Overall pips won on 100 trades 140  
  
But in the statistics of the 100 trades there is the scenario of the 1st 40 trades being losers and the last 60 trades being winners  
If you belive in the system and risk 1% of account of each trade thats fine but Im trying to find out the best time frame and the best swaps.  
Swaps can change but some methods work better on longer time frames ..it all takes time but the EA with back testing I think can help.I just need to make sure we build in all the paremeters we need to fully test it.  
  
The chart below shows the 123 reversal .. what would save us is go to break even at a cetain level in the trade if the reversal appears were safe..again this needs to be built into the EA for testing

Hi Peter..If I can just add my 2 pennies worth here esp as your going live Monday  
  
If you have taken this into account then ignore the post but trading across several swaps with various pips values can be potential account blowing  
  
Taking things to the xtreme for an eaxample  
  
4 swaps pip value   
  
1 $10 per pip  
2 $10 per pip  
3 $10 per pip  
4 $50 per pip  
  
TP and SL the same  
  
You make 4 trades close each for the same amount of pips ( 2pips for example) 1,2,3 as above all win = 3 wins 2pips each = 60 pips  
4th trade loses = $100  
  
Strike rate is a good 75% but you lose on the account  
  
The way to get around trading over several swaps all with different pip values is to take the SL size for each trade and convert to %  
  
So trade 1 100 pips SL take 2% of account and and use that to buy contracts to the value of $100  
  
Then trade 4 with higher pip value 100pip SL t ake 2% of account and use that to buy contracts to the value of $100  
  
The loss will be the same as you are trading the %  
  
An inexpensive EA can do all this for you instaly when your order is filled  
  
So you get a big down candle of 200 pips you get filled on the next bar and you dont get nervous because your trading a 200 pip SL because your only going to risk 2%  
  
Hope that helps  
  
p

Bob, guys, I am assuming that the more signals combined the stronger the signal, for instance EURUSD has a S3 on 3 time frames, weekly daily and 4H, some examples below: -  
  
S3 trade signals valid for Monday  
  
EURUSD WEEK DAY 4H  
USDCHF WEEK DAY 4H  
AUDCAD WEEK DAY 4H  
AUDUSD DAY 4H  
NZDUSD DAY 4H  
EURJPY DAY 4H  
GBPUSD 4H  
USDJPY 4H  
  
If we trade the strongest either on the 4H or daily trigger then we could measure the success of those trades against the "weaker" signals. Personally I would like to see the signals combined with price action and I don't want to be heading into strong support or resistance, so I would be looking for price to break any levels with momentum and any retraces rejected. Good luck what ever you decide.

Currently on my phone, so cannot post a chart. But looking at the charts using this system, you can generally tell which way the trend will go. #3 discs are the most important. I generally use the H4 time frame, and use the S&R lvls to confirm as i said. It is important to wait till the trend swings the other way before you enter, DO NOT countertrend trade, MM fake outs are hell for us amateurs. The H1 chart usually gives a #3 disc when the H4 chart gives a #2 disc, i take this into consideration looking at a few other factors, but generally i do not exit a trade until the H4 chart tells me to do so (also looking at S&R lvls).  
  
I've lately been more A LOT more confident in myself with how i've been trading, i'm starting to see more just by looking at a regular chart, so i haven't even been using SL's (demo). Good way to improve confidence, however i seriously do not recommend this if you decide to go live.

Hi. I've been using this technic with my own style. I use candlestick pattern as guide and confirmation to enter. I'll makesure the Yellow dot semaphore have this candlestick confirmation. And the swing is on ! ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f601.png?v=15.1)  
  
For the SL. I'll move based on the dot. If sell :   
1st SL - Yellow dot  
2nd SL - 1st Red dot  
3rd SL - 2nd Red dot  
and so on until the Yellow dot have been seen.

Hello Esosa,  
  
I back-tested a lot of strategies, these are my special tricks to understand the movements, i have the history from 2005 till now, especially with M1 and daily charts. 2006 and 2007 EURUSD markets were less trending and more choppy. Opposite in 2013 and 2014 (continue till now), the market in EU is less choppy and more trending...  
  
Results can be different when we trade different pairs at the same time, but i don't think that the system has a long living time. System is good to make some quick money but for the long run, i would prefer not to trade with this if i am serious with my capital.  
  
Trading the My Market Order system can be very profitable if traded with discretion, its experience which makes money, not a system. Some naked traders are managing to make even 100% per month of their capital with consistency, you know what? It is their experience which makes money for them. About me, soooooo, i am very much happy with my system. Remember what i said, "Bob's system is profitable if traded with discretion", just like Orid did.

Forexswag, the original idea is to take the trade 10 pips below / above the bottom / above of the signal candle ( when a 3 pops up) which would give you an earlier signal.  
  
The PZ (which I have on my charts) provides a signal a little later, I am using PZ as confirmation of my entry. If after some bars of entering trade I don't get the PZ signal, than I consider closing earlier and only taking a small loss.  
  
Also, I am not sure that the PZ settings you are using on your chart are optimised for a 1hr chart, your entry signal seems very late, Eitan may wish to clarify or correct me on that one.  
  
I hope what I said makes sense, Forexswag, and good luck with your trading.  
  
Cheers  
Ezzy

Simple tips to reduce MT4 memory use  
Jan 18, 2011  
Most active traders usually have more than one MetaTrader 4 terminal open at the time for different reasons, either have multiple accounts, demo trading in several brokers, comparing strategies, etc.  
But the limiting factor to how many Metatraders you can run on a computer is based on the CPU speed and available memory. This can be a big problem when running MetaTrader on a VPS where you have to pay more if you need more resources like memory, speed or space.  
Here are a few simple configuration changes you can make to reduce MetaTraders memory footprint.

  1. The most important change is to open the option screen by pressing CTL + O, go to the Charts Tab and reduce the Max bars in history and Max bars in chart to 5000, this will limit how many bars are displayed on the chart and in the history making this installation unsuitable for back testing but it will use less memory on live or demo trading.
  2. Also disable every feature you do not use on the Email, Publisher and Events Tabs.
  3. Disable the News on the Server Tab.
  4. Close all charts that you are not using, each chart uses memory.
  5. Open Market Watch (CTL + M) > right click and Hide All, deleting all pairs that are not in use.
  6. Remove any Indicator you do not need.
  7. On expert Advisors if possible disable logging, the less you write to the Hard Drive, the faster your MetaTrader will run on a VPS.
  8. Restart your MetaTrader so the changes will take effect.
  9. Restart MetaTrader regularly to maintain memory usage low, MetaTrader keeps all the history data for the opened charts in RAM and only writes it to disk into the History folder when MetaTrader closes.
  10. You should also reboot you machine often and exit any programs that you are not using, on a VPS machine you could also disable many services that you do not need.

Creditors have better memories than debtors.

You need to copy your .ex4 file into the MT4's Data Folder. To do so:  
  
1\. Open your MT4 and click the File menu>Open Data Folder>MQL4>Indicators.  
2\. Copy your .ex4 and paste it into the above folder.  
3\. Restart MT4 and go to Custom Indicators in the Navigator window. You'll find your indi there.  
  
Hope this helps.

First of all a big thanks to bobhowson for sharing his system and all the members on this thread for their hard work to help others.  
  
I have a few suggestions for addressing the repainting issue of the 3 level zz semafor indicator as follows:

  1. Trade only a level 3 signal and verify it on the next higher time frame. Take the trade only if at least a level 2 signal has appeared simultaneously on the higher time frame, otherwise disregard it.
  2. Use only a STOP order and avoid LIMIT order. This way, if the indicator repaints, the order will likely remain unfilled and can be deleted or adjusted accordingly. On the other hand, if the STOP order fills, it is more likely that it will do so in the direction of the trade and the indicator will not repaint.

Thanks again.  
Tariq

Hi Taru  
  
As you know, the semaphore indicator repaints, there is no way around that. However, that does not mean that it can't help us in making decisions for our trading.  
  
Some things to consider when you get a 3ball semaphore signal are: Trend, supply demand areas, psych areas etc.  
  
Here are Bob's rule from his first post  
  
Happy trading  
Ezzy  
  

1) 3 Level ZZ Semafor Indicator... That's It !

**_THE RULES FOR UP TREND_**

1) Only Trade The Daily Charts

2) Ensure You Have A Nice Trend

3) _ALL TRADES ARE MARKET ORDERS_

4) Place Your STOP LOSS UNDER The **GREEN DOT** After It Closes

5) Place Your **BUY STOP ORDER** 10 Pips Or So Above The GREEN DOT

6) Keep Moving Your Stop UP Every 50 or So Pips

7) Close The Trade When A PINK or **RED DOT** Appears.

That's It !

  
  

What you do is a reflection of you....what I do is a reflection of me.

For eg:  
1) In and uptrend trade from the BOTTOM of the Trend Channel  
2) If there is a LARGE DOT at the bottom which means a BUY Trade is about to happen WAIT for Cythis's System to give the BUY ALERT  
3) Then Enter into the trade.  
4) DO NOT TRADE if there is a WHITE CROSS wait for this to disappear.

Dear bobhowson,  
  
Please accept my condolences on the loss of your mother. May she rest in peace.  
  
Coming to the original system as posted by you, I found the zz semafor indicator very useful to pick reversals on the 4 hourly charts. During the first full week of trading with it (27 April - 3 May), I netted 392 pips risking 1% per trade and a 60 pips fixed stop loss.  
  
However, I was plagued by the repainting issue with many trades hitting S/L. I therefore decided to experiment with a few "filters". The first was to consider only a level 3 signal. Next was to validate it by looking for a minimum level 2 signal forming simultaneously on the next higher time frame (the daily in my case). Finally, I decided to place pending orders in the expected direction of the price action, in other words, STOP orders.   
  
With the above adjustments in place, my second week with the system (that just concluded last night) produced 1,134 pips with +1,747 pips of floating or unrealized P/L. Of course it is too soon to know if this ain't a fluke but I must say I just love the way this indicator works. As a matter of fact, the repaints have actually saved me from entering into bad trades or prematurely pulling the plug on profitable ones.  
  
Thanks again.  
  
Tariq 

The trader IS the holy grail.

Next I want to discuss the exit.  
  
I don't have a TP in mind and let the market decide. Therefore, if a trade survives long enough to be profitable, a time comes when a valid reversal appears. I simply place a new STOP order in the reverse direction and move the SL of the open trade to the same level. The following chart may help. Please note that you may not be able to see the SL of the SELL trade as it is "buried" under the pending BUY STOP order but its very much there.

Initially, I too thought the repainting to be a big pain. However, on closer scrutiny, I now believe it to be more a blessing than a curse. If used correctly, a semafor signal is very powerful and one doesn't need anything else to pick out great entries. Of course you'd still need rock solid discipline, money management, patience, a trader's mindset and realistic expectations but most of these you'd need with anything in life to succeed, let alone trading.

  * [#874](/thread/post/7462119#post7462119 "Post Permalink")

  * May 12, 2014 2:50am  May 12, 2014 2:50am 

  * [ taru](taru)

  * | Joined Jul 2013  | Status: Trader | [263 Posts](/search?do=process&provider=Member&searchuser=344999)

To all those who are afraid of the repainting zz semafor, let me suggest the following approach:

  1. Lets say you've just spotted a level 3 semafor on the current candle. Should you immediately trade it? NO. It just means that a significant reversal is around the corner but this by itself may or may not be it. We need more information to be sure.
  2. Now wait for the current candle to close and then wait again for the next one to close as well.
  3. Now look again at these two candles. Did the semafor jump (aka. repaint) from the first candle to the next one? If yes, just go back to step 1. If no, the chances are that the semafor has "set" and not likely to move again. The time has come to place your trade.

The trader IS the holy grail.

Another thing that I've observed is a higher probability reversal setup where a follow-on candle breaks the high or low of the preceding semafor candle. This means that a follow-on candle has a higher high than the semafor candle in a BUY setup, or a lower low than the semafor candle in a SELL setup. This may suit a trader with a conservative approach who'd like to trade only high probability setups. I've attached a chart to pinpoint three such setups. Hope this is helpful.

Do you get the situation where semaphor appears on both 4hr and daily, so you place the trade and then the daily semaphor disappears at the start of the next candle ? Does this invalidate your trade ? An early exit perhaps ? cheers Stan[/quote]  
  
You are welcome Stan.  
  
Now about your questions.  
  
**By checking to see if the semaphor is on the daily chart, aren't you in fact just trading the Daily TF ?**  
Yes and no. Yes because a higher time frame contributes to the decision whether to trade or not. No because the actual entry is determined by the lower time frame and may be contained anywhere within the range of the higher time frame candle.   
  
**Do you get the situation where semaphor appears on both 4hr and daily, so you place the trade and then the daily semaphor disappears at the start of the next candle ?**  
By virtue of its logic, once it appears a zz semafor can repaint but never disappear.   
  
**Does this invalidate your trade ? An early exit perhaps ?**  
Nope. As I explained above, a semafor cannot disappear. 

The trader IS the holy grail.

The Euro is in a bit of a free fall due to the negative sentiment generated by the ZEW releases almost two hours ago.  
  
This is a fact of life for a forex trader and occurs quite often. What should one do now? I don't know about anyone else but I'm going to DO NOTHING. What if a few of my trades hit SL? Thats just 1% loss per trade. I know my edge works and I'll recover all of that later in just one good trade. Like a pilot needs to believe what his instruments are telling him while flying in bad weather at night, a trader needs to believe his system when the market turns against him/her.   
  
As for the EURJPY trade some of us made. I'm currently down 22 pips. From here, it'll either go down a further 38 pips and hit the SL or rebound, go into profit and give me the opportunity to exit in line with system rules. Either way, I am alright with it. If this trade doesn't end in profit, so what? There'll be others that would. 

The trader IS the holy grail.

Here are a couple of MTF indicators to show the daily candle and daily semafor on a 4 hr chart, so you don't have to switch back and forth between timeframes. You need both semafor indi's in your indicator folder for the MTF one to work. Also, I have the mq4 files, but they won't work after compiling on Build 645. I had to compile them on an older mt4 version, then the ex4 files will work in Build 645. (the mtf semafor didn't work at all at first... several lines were commented out in error, which I fixed).  
  
Load up the mtf semafor first, then the regular one (so that the smaller semafors will be visible on top of the larger ones). If you want the mtf daily candles, load that up before the semafors.

I have carried out a preliminary audit of my trades and have drawn a very interesting conclusion. The 3 level zz semafor is a super indicator provided its used correctly. Of course that's true for everything but for this indicator to help a trader, one needs to understand that the semafors it paints look similar but carry different meanings depending on the context.  
  
Basically the best use of the 3 level zz semafor indicator is to **signal the end of a short term correction and resumption of the main trend**.  
  
In other words, the best use of a semafor signal is in the direction of the main trend, not against it.  
  
Based on the above, I'm adding a further filter to my way of validating a setup on the daily charts for the H4 trading method as follows:  
  
1\. LONG level 3 signal must be higher than the previous LONG level 3 signal OR SHORT level 3 signal must be lower than the previous SHORT level 3 signal.  
2\. LONG level 2 signal must be higher than the previous LONG level 2 or 3 signal OR SHORT level 2 signal must be lower than the previous SHORT level 2 or 3 signal.  
  
This means that the first opposite level 2 signal occurring after a level 3 signal will be discarded as it won't have anything to be compared with.  
Hope this helps all of us. 

The trader IS the holy grail.

hi tai9127, I agree with your idea of trying to control the repaint issue, but I would do it another way,   
  
Place BuyStop above the GREEN 3 DOT --- SellStop under the GREEN 3 DOT  
Place SellStop under RED 3 DOT BuyStop above the RED 3 Green Dot  
  
The idea is to stay with the current trend before trying to go against it. In my view placing a BuyLimit under the Green 3 Dot and vice versa for the RED 3 DOT is like catching a falling knife.

You are welcome Feefee.  
  
I'm just testing this way of trading the semaphor for less than 2 weeks, so nothing is written in stone here. I've been playing with the semaphor since the start of this thread with no sucess due to repainting issue. Yes, this indi is repainting and a lot. So, if you trade it mechanically, no way you will make money.  
  
I then started following Taru' rules for entry and exit. Read his comments carrefully. They are very clear, well explained and I learnt a lot from them. I experienced too much losses though and decided to add a new filter to stay on the current trend of the daily time frame. I use Macd, but I guess you could use any other indi like stoch or MA. What I like in Taru's method is that it enables you to stay in the trend for long.  
  
I follow all pairs save for exotics, but MM is key here. Just 1% risk per trade.  
  
Hope it helps.  
  
By the way, closed AU for more tan 2 R:R. Had another loss on GJ, so 4 losses now, but floating profit still growing.... ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f973.png?v=15.1)

SL: just below or above the semaphor dot.

Hi Tai,  
You've got it in a nut shell...  
If you have the Semafor at the bottom, which means there's a possible BUY trade set up make sure the Stochastic is also at the bottom ( Over Sold ).  
And if the Large dot is at the top which means a possible SELL trade make sur e the Stochastic is also at the top ( Over Bought )  
I will trade the pair untill I hit the next Semafor, trading the pull backs and the main trend even when there is minor semafor, but that's just my way at the moment. I have tried a few different trading methods but I always end up back with the Semafor system... I Love It !  
The system is still very basic and can be traded a few different ways as we have seen in the forum, but we still have that good ole Semafor as our indicator.  
Cheers !  
Bob

Before I make a trade I look through all the pairs and pick trades that have a closed #3 Semafor candle. I only trade around 4 pairs at a time, ensuring I don't over trade.  
My Stop goes above or below the 3# dot, I then take the trade, I used to use a Buy or Stop Order but not any more. I don't seem to have that much trouble with repainting. As soon as another semafor dot appears for the opposite direction I close my current trade and place a new one for the opposite trend. I tend to use 0.05 per $100 in my bank..  
eg: $100 balance I trade 0.05 when it reaches $200 use 0.10, $300 use 015 which is $1.50 per pip....ect ect  
Hope this all helps..  
Cheers !  
Bob

1\. I do not post charts or answer a lot of redundant questions. Mainly because because I am not good at expressing myself other than in an original post.  
2\. If you don't like how Bob uses the indicators then come up with your own. I use his method with a couple of tweaks.  
MY Tweaks with BOBS method:  
In my looking back at charts I put Heiken Ashi bars on the chart and found that if you wait for the change of color after the Semafor signal you will be pretty solid in your entries. I also added the only other indicator I use which is the TDI (Traders Dynamic Index) to confirm the Semafor signal. It MUST have a cross and the Heiken ashi bars must change color before I take the trade. I trade only H4 and Daily  
  
If you have questions then try it out for a week or so and then ask. Or use Semafor confirmed with the Stoch Oscillator as Bob does. Either will work. Patience is key. Closed candles are key. Money management is key.  
  
The method is Bobs - It is a good method where he trades and with the broker he uses. We must use his ideas and come up with what works for us in our situation.  
  
Good trading guys and thanks many times over for sharing your method Bob.  
edit: I notice Bobha and Shinewel both use the APB or Heiken ashi bars. Also I use the 5 ema with a 3 shift which is further confirmation. Basically I use the Trading Made Simple started by eelfranz and combine it with Bobs method.

I'm really still a beginner only been trading for around 18 months, so when it comes to the technical s _de of trading I'm buggered. I do know that the smaller the semafor number on the dot the less reliable it is. I only trade these on the 4H if it is a #2 or 3. Other than that, when I trade the minor semafor sometime it will only last a day or two on the 4H timeframe. I usually check my trades at 7am, 11am, 3pm, 7pm and 11pm if there is a new semafor I will close and trade and start another if it fits all the rules. I suppose you could say I surf the candles up and down, since doing this I've made a lots more pips.

first of all, you must understand, the whole thread is all about spotting the beginning of a trend reversal or a big pull back which is also in other words swing trade opportunities....  
so we are looking for change in the swing and to enter early to ride with the swing  
audjpy is in the uptrend....now rather possibly near the end of an uptrend  
if the set up says end of the present long trend you look for opportunities to short  
if the set up says continuation of the present long trend, you trade long (for which you should see a fractal at the bottom in 4 hr chart)  
in the present scenario you see neither of them  
so we need to wait to see the fractal, to take any position and to make profits  
now we are in between a long swing....we are looking for beginning/end of any swings  
however you can enter long trades using smaller time frames............ 

learn and earn from the ups and downs...of life.

Yes, Cavenlee92 you are starting to understand it now, keep up the good work!  
  
I think if we use the D1/H4 combination we might be able to get in fractal swings earlier and be able to stay in longer.  
  
I'm going to try this:

  1. Wait for Fractals to appear on the Daily charts first
  2. After getting the signal, drop down to the lower 4 Hour charts and check out and confirm the Stochastics for proper OB/OS levels
  3. Wait for any pullbacks or retracement to complete (if necessary)
  4. Set My Pending Stop Order(s) in the direction of the current fractal from the Daily
  5. Then switch back to the upper/higher time frame chart {Daily charts} and hold my positions for several days until it looks like another opposite fractal forms again while monitoring the Daily chart
  6. Then rinse and repeat in the opposite direction [repeating steps 1-5] and ride the next fractal swing (trend leg) for more pips

It's time we stop entertaining ourselves and start realizing ourselves!

But yes, any of these chart combinations would be great:

  1. Monthly fractal signal appears then drop down to the Weekly for entry if Stochastics is Overbought/Oversold
  2. Weekly fractal signal appears then drop down to the Daily for entry if Stochastics is Overbought/Oversold
  3. Daily fractal signal appears then drop down to the 4H for entry if Stochastics is Overbought/Oversold
  4. 4H fractal signal appears then drop down to the 1H for entry if Stochastics is Overbought/Oversold
  5. 1H fractal signal appears then drop down to the 30M for entry if Stochastics is Overbought/Oversold

I would not go any lower than the 1H/30M combination if I was a scalper or day trader.  
  
But for me, I prefer longer term charts (Monthly, Weekly and Daily) and like to hold my positions for days, weeks and even months and collect as many pips as possible without looking at the charts and staring at the computer screen all day ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f60a.png?v=15.1)

I'm re-upping this quote from the thread starter Bob just to remind everyone of a great way to filter out false signals. Thanks to Bob, Taru and Porfirio and many others on this thread I have gained much needed insight.  
  
But the question is why did so many of the earlier contributors give up on this method and thread when it does indeed work?
